name: Assembly of European Regions
goal:
The Assembly of European Regions (est.1985) is the largest independent network of regions in the wider Europe. Bringing together 150+ regions from 35 countries and 15 interregional organisations, AER's mission is to:
- Promote the principle of subsidiarity and regional democracy
- Increase the regions' political influence within the European institutions
- Support the regions in the process of European enlargement and globalisation
- Facilitate interregional cooperation across wider Europe and beyond
interests: Agriculture, Budget, Business and Industry, Climate Action, Culture, Digital economy and society, Economy, finance and the euro, Education and training, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enlargement, Environment, Food Safety, General and Institutional Affairs, Migration and asylum, Public Health, Regional Policy, Research and innovation, Single market, Trans-European Networks, Transport, Youth
euInitiatives: Policies and legislation with an impact at the regional level, more specifically in the fields of economy and regional development, cohesion policy, public health and social affairs, youth, culture, education, international cooperation, equal opportunities, institutional affairs.
